body_html: And when I executed command like cmake -E env PYTHONPATH=$a $b $c ... or cmake -E env PYTHONPATH=$a;$b;$c ..., neither of them is correctly executed in cmake building process. The correct pattern I think is cmake -E env PYTHONPATH="$a;$b;$c" ... but I found the cmake interprets it as PYTHONPATH=$a $b $c or something like PYTHONPATH=\"$a $b $c\" which definitely incurs errors
body_text: And when I executed command like cmake -E env PYTHONPATH=$a $b $c ... or cmake -E env PYTHONPATH=$a;$b;$c ..., neither of them is correctly executed in cmake building process. The correct pattern I think is cmake -E env PYTHONPATH="$a;$b;$c" ... but I found the cmake interprets it as PYTHONPATH=$a $b $c or something like PYTHONPATH=\"$a $b $c\" which definitely incurs errors
body: And when I executed command like `cmake -E env PYTHONPATH=$a $b $c ...` or `cmake -E env PYTHONPATH=$a;$b;$c ...`, neither of them is correctly executed in cmake building process. The correct pattern I think is `cmake -E env PYTHONPATH="$a;$b;$c" ...` but I found the cmake interprets it as `PYTHONPATH=$a $b $c` or something like `PYTHONPATH=\"$a $b $c\"` which definitely incurs errors
